conversation.content: Um, hi! So like, funny story—I'm actually a career counselor and I, uh, literally can't figure out your phone menu.
Oh no, I'm so, um, I'm really sorry about that. Let me just, uh, uh, pull up your account here and—yeah the the phone system is, um, honestly terrible. What's what's your account number?
Right, it's... wait, account number or customer ID?
Either one works! So um, basically they're, uh, they're kind of the same thing in our system which is, er, super confusing I know.
Okay so... hmm, let me see here... ACC-4920-JT.
Got it got it, um, so that's pulling up as, uh, invalid but but sometimes people mix up—is it maybe, um, JTC-4920 instead?
Oh! Yes, sorry—wait no, that's my, um, that's actually my license number. Ugh. I help people navigate systems for a living!
No no, totally get it. These codes all look—they're all the same. Okay okay, can I just grab your email?
Um, yeah it's, uh, karencounselor at... wait, which email did I use? Personal or work?
Let me let me try both! What're what're the options?
So there's, um, ksmith at careerpath dot com or, uh, wait—actually might be under my old one?
You know what? I'm I'm just gonna search by name. Karen Smith?
Yep! Though, hmm, might be under K Smith or, um, Katherine? I honestly can't remember what I—
Found you! Account ACC-7823-KLM. So so what happened with the phone menu?
Um, okay so I pressed 2 for billing then, uh, 4 for... no wait, was it 3 for payments?
Oh oh oh, yeah no. The the menu's backwards. Billing's actually 4 now and and payments is under accounts which is, um, which is 2. We switched it last month and and honestly? Even I can't remember.
That's—wait, so I had it right the first time? But then, um, why did it send me to Spanish?
Because—and and this is so dumb—if you press 2 twice by accident? It thinks you want español. Your account shows, um, three Spanish preference switches today.
Oh my god. I tell my clients about terrible UX all day and here I am... This is so ironic.

Listen, um, between you and me? I've worked here two years and and I still get lost. Last week I tried calling in sick and and somehow ordered myself a new modem. Reference number MDM-8827-QX if you can believe it.

scenario: career counselor, ironic that she can't navigate this company's terrible phone system
